Software Test Analyst

Company Name Easy Weddings Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 640 views

Job description

Test Analyst

\xa0

  • Join our award-winning R&D team
  • Competitive salary
  • Distinctive culture
  • Located in Mulgrave

\xa0

This is your opportunity to join a highly visible, high traffic suite of web properties. Easy Weddings is a rapidly growing company with a strong investment back into R&D. We're looking for a test analyst to join our talented and enthusiastic delivery team.

\xa0

If you are friendly, fun, hard-working and at the top of your quality assurance game we are looking for you to be the next person to slide down our office slide and ensure our delivery team has consistently high-quality outcomes as we streamline our development environment, create new products and enter new markets.

\xa0

We will need you to:

\xa0

  • Develop and execute test cases for all supported devices and platforms.
  • Identify requirements and design specs which are inconsistent with the overall user experience.
  • Identify, document and manage bugs introduced during the development cycle.
  • Coordinate with technical team members to ensure problems found during testing are resolved.
  • Contribute to team improvement initiatives such as tooling, process changes, and automation.
  • Coordinate with and manage QA responsibilities with offsite test analyst

\xa0

Exposure to any of the following is a definite plus:

\xa0

  • Automated testing tools such as Selenium
  • BDD testing frameworks such as SpecFlow
  • Managing test environments

\xa0

Why you want to work with Easy Weddings?

We don't do 'jobs' at Easy Weddings.\xa0We pride ourselves on being a community, rather than just a workplace. Situated in Mulgrave, Victoria, along the Southern Eastern Freeway and about 30 minutes from the Melbourne CBD, our headquarters is the perfect mix of professionalism and fun.

\xa0

Check out our team here:

https://www.youtube.com/embed/YL3d0U9ELXk

\xa0

* While we appreciate that as a recruitment/personnel agency you may have excellent candidates for this role, it would be greatly appreciated if you did not contact us, as we handle our recruitment internally. *

Job description

OUR COMPANY

The Marketing Manager will be responsible for the development and execution of the marketing and communication strategies for Australia’s leading cleaning hire brands Britex & Rug Doctor. As well as for Immuron which sells over-the-counter medicines (Travelan &, Protectyn) in Australia and in the USA

The individual will lead key aspects of brand management and will work closely with Senior Management to achieve short and long-term commercial marketing objectives.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Be responsible for developing and delivering on the brands’ communications & marketing plan strategy including, e-commerce, websites plus social, digital & traditional media.
  • Devise and improve company’s SEO/SEM strategy.
  • Grow and utilize company’s customer database for ongoing communication.
  • Managing the marketing communications, advertising, events, promotions and PR calendar.
  • Lead and manage the new product development cycle from conception through to implementation.
  • Analyze qualitative / quantitative market data to generate a deeper understanding of the customer's needs, brand management issues, market potential, gaps in current data and to refine strategies.
  • Manage and direct staff (Marketing Coordinator)
  • Managing the process of identifying, contacting and cultivating key centers of influence.

Key Requirements:

  • Degree qualified in Marketing, Business or related
  • At least 5 years experience in a Marketing role, strong focus on B2C. Extensive digital marketing experience highly regarded
  • Relevant marketing experience in the retail consumer brand, FMCG, biotechnology or specialty pharmaceutical industries; including product management experience.
  • Proven experience in developing and delivering multi channel marketing campaigns
  • Strong stakeholder management and relationship building skills

How to apply:

  • If you have the relevant skills for this role and want to be a part of our great team, please Apply ensuring you include a cover letter with your resume.

[

Customer Solutions Consultant

Company Name MAS National Company Location Epping, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 41 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

MAS National are seeking a talented 'Customer Solutions Consultant (CSC)' to work in our Epping Office!


Customer Solutions Consultants (CSC’s) play a crucial role in ensuring a high level of customer service is provided in relation to the Australian Apprenticeship Support Network (AASN) services. Customer Solutions Consultants work as part of the national team of CSC’s providing advice, support and information to apprentices and employers, as well as administrative functions to ensure efficient and effective delivery. CSC’s work closely with local Business Consultants (BC’s), BC Team Leaders and State Managers to achieve the outcomes and directions set by the National CSC Manager.


Duties

In this challenging and varied role your main focus will be:

  • Provide phone and face to face support on the full range of services
  • Provide Gateway by assisting job seekers readiness for employment including skills and abilities, realistic and relevant employer opportunities.
  • Attend Schools and Expo’s to promote and coordinate MAS recruitment services including presentations, website uploading of information on apprentice CVs, employment opportunities and general enquiries.
  • Provide In-Training Support (mentoring) to our apprentices/trainees within their first 3 months of their apprenticeship.

Skills and Knowledge

To be successful in the role, you will have:

• Proven experience in a similar role
• Experience in providing accurate advice with key focus on Customer Excellence
• Excellent communication skills both verbally and written
• Excellent organisational skills with a sense of urgency without compromising quality of service

•\xa0Attention to detail for data entry
• Ability to meet and exceed targets

• Ability to contribute to the growth of the organisation
• Ability to work well as part of a team and autonomously
• Experience working with TYIMS and Job Ready Active systems would be desirable
• Knowledge and or experience with Apprenticeships, Training Contracts and protocols
• Understanding of the Australian Government Incentives and of Apprenticeship guidelines



Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia.\xa0

A current Working with Children Blue Card and National Police Check is required and can be arranged for the suitable applicant.


Indigenous candidates are highly encouraged to apply.

If you believe you're the person for this role, please apply through LinkedIn and make sure you attach your CV and cover letter.\xa0


Applications close Monday, 10th September.

[

Aerospace Auditor

Company Name SAI Global Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you a Self-Employed Auditor qualified in Aerospace Auditor Transition Training (AATT) and OASIS listed AS auditor credentials as an AS9100C AEA?\xa0


The Role

Based out of our Office in Port Melbourne, you will be a self-employed contract auditor with previous Aerospace Auditing experience across a range of industries to service clients locally and nationally.

\xa0

The Aerospace Auditor will be responsible to perform assessments in manufacturing and service industries against internationally recognized management system standards.

\xa0

Responsibilities

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Conduct manual reviews and pre-assessments to ensure that the requirements of the standard have been met and provide the appropriate feedback to the customer to address any shortcomings.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Plan and arrange management system audits in accordance with internationally recognized aerospace standards and guidelines, including establishing audit schedules a few months in advance in consultation with team members and the customer. .

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Prepare audit plan using audit planning program according to initial registration, annual/bi-annual surveillance or re-registration visits. Review previous audits if undertaking a surveillance, upgrade or re-registration audit, ensuring relevant elements are selected. Arranges all travel plans, provides directions and other relevant information to audit team members.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Conduct audits, determining compliance of customer's management system to applicable standards by interviewing customer staff at all levels, completing checklist, and drawing conclusions on compliance, and documenting findings. Liaise with team members to determine validity of their findings in relation to lead auditor findings.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Present findings to customers and prepares audit report. Advises customers of SAI Global requirements, such as the number of days to address non-conformances.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Reviews all team members’ documentation for accuracy and completeness. Ensure all documents required by the respective standard are in place for presentation to the Registration Review Team.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Other duties as assigned.

\xa0

\xa0

Selection Criteria

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Minimum of 5 years previous related experience in the engineering, quality and/or auditing field.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Valid driver’s license to visit customer sites.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Experience in a variety of nace codes, or the ability to quickly understand, learn and relate to a variety of industries and their customer's needs and requirements.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Completion of Aerospace Auditor Transition Training (AATT) and OASIS listed AS auditor credentials as an AS9100C AEA.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Certification as a Lead Auditor, with regular certification renewal.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Computer proficiency in word-processing, spreadsheets and databases.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Working knowledge of various management system standards and guidelines

\xa0

To take advantage of this opportunity click 'Apply'\xa0or for further information - email recruitment@saiglobal.com

Job description

Clarendons is a corporate specialist law firm.


We are a group of smart, straight-up, open and passionate people. \xa0


A team that takes pride in building long term relationships and delivering exceptional results.

We are experts in public and private M&A, ECM, private equity and venture capital, and general corporate and commercial law.


We are trusted advisers to leading Australian and international companies, private equity and venture capital funds, family offices and business owners across a broad range of industries and sectors.


Our clients benefit from our extensive experience, outstanding legal knowledge and skills, strong project management, effective negotiating and responsiveness. With Clarendons, our clients know they are receiving the very best legal advice – a team of dedicated and experienced lawyers is representing them.


The Opportunity


Due to sustained and ongoing growth, the opportunity for Associate or Senior Associate level corporate / M&A lawyers to join our growing practice has arisen.


As a member of our practice you will work across the firm.\xa0 We want to engage you and provide an opportunity for you to grow and develop and undertake great work.\xa0 We take pride in our work and are unashamed of our success.\xa0\xa0


The firm offers candidates high quality work and training and mentoring by some of Melbourne’s leading corporate lawyers.


Recent transactions we have been involved in can be found on our website from the link https://clarendonlawyers.com.au/transactions/


What You'll Bring


To succeed in this role you will need

  • 3 plus years post admission experience from a Corporate / M&A practice.
  • A desire to grow, both as a lawyer and leader.

\xa0We commit to:

  • Providing fantastic work that will challenge you to be your best.
  • Providing a great work environment so you can do your best work.
  • Support and engage you in your professional growth and development as a lawyer and leader.


How to Apply\xa0

[

Structural Drafter

Company Name Beca Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 118 views

Job description


Structural Drafter
Industrial Team at Beca
There are endless opportunities and no shortage of exciting projects within the food and beverage, mining and metals, forestry and chemicals and manufacturing sectors. Our Industrial buildings team also support our Power, Water and Infrastructure sectors. You'll join a diverse and talented team delivering creative, innovative solutions in partnership with our clients.

The Opportunity
The Industrial Buildings team in Australia consist of engineers, architects and designers who work collaboratively across the business to deliver a broad range of light and heavy industrial projects within markets including Food & Beverage, Mining & Metals, Power, Water, Rail and Manufacturing.

The Structural Drafter is involved in preparing and coordinating the delivery of BIM models structural steelwork & concrete drawings for a range of industrial building structures projects across Australia, New Zealand and Asia Pacific. In this role you will have the opportunity to take a lead role in the delivery of work packages and offering guidance and advice in the provision of design services to our clients.

Based in our Melbourne office, you will have the chance to work in a highly collaborative team that is focussed on creating a culture of creativity and innovation, developing long-term client relationships and empowering the success of our people.

About you


You will have experience as a Structural Drafter within our key market sectors and specifically with industrial buildings. We are also looking for:

  • Relevant tertiary qualification (Adv. Diploma, Diploma or Certificate) in Civil/Structural engineering is essential
  • Capability to deliver projects from inception through to completion, working collaboratively within a multidisciplinary environment
  • Experience in leading design delivery to internal and external customers and clients
  • A Sound understanding of relevant Australian Standards and Building Codes
  • Experience in both AutoCAD, Revit and Navisworks
  • Outstanding communication skills and the flexibility to work across a broad range of technically complex projects


Consideration will be made for a fixed term, contract or permanent position to be discussed with the candidate.



About Beca
Our clients do incredible things every day. They are transforming their communities and changing lives through the structures they build, the products they manufacture, the services they provide, and the families they support. And we are right there alongside them.

We are the problem-solvers - the thinkers, the creators, the planners and practitioners - who understand their vision and make things happen! We are 3000-plus professionals spread across 19 offices across the Asia Pacific.

While our experience has been 98 years in the making, it's the fresh talent we're nurturing, the innovative thinking we're developing and the connections that we're forging, that get us most excited for the future.

Apply

 We can provide support with relocation and immigration to suitable applicants. You can find out more about our people and projects by visiting www.beca.com.


We look forward to hearing from you!

Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture - open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences
